newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia cenbank mulls withdrawing 130 bank licences.
newsitem.headline: Russia cenbank mulls withdrawing 130 bank licences.

text.p: Russia's central bank is considering withdrawing licences from 130 banks, a senior official of the bank said on Tuesday.

"Besides the 130 banks, there are about 200 more banks with a negative capital. They are also banks from which we can withdraw licences, if they do not stabilise their financial situation," deputy chairman Alexander Turbanov told a round-table discussion on the banking industry.
So far this year the central bank has withdrawn 200 licences and registered only 16 new banks, he said. In 1995 the central bank withdrew 225 licences and granted 86.
"This testifies to the fact that the central bank is toughening its requirements both when granting licences and to the banks which do not fulfil obligatory economic requirements," Turbanov said.
He called the process a purge from the banking sector of banks incapable of working in a market economy, and said this would make the industry healthier.
